<<<api>>>: String.getBytes
<<<code>>>: 
try { 
    byte[] b = string.getBytes(Charset.forName("UTF-8")); 
} catch (Exception e) { 
    e.printStackTrace(); 
}
<<<explanation>>>: The issue in your code is that you are using the toString() method on the byte array, which returns a string representation of the object, not the actual content of the byte array. To convert a byte array to a string and then back to a byte array, you can use the String.getBytes() method to convert the string to a byte array. However, keep in mind that this will use the default character encoding, so it's recommended to specify the character encoding explicitly, as shown in the code snippet above.
